Articles.Content: I want to be able to run private multiplayer servers that work when im not online
I just hope it runs well on Wine. I use FreeBSD for my desktop, so while I'd love to see a native port, realistically it'll never happen.

11 hours ago, kspnerd122 said:

I want to be able to run private multiplayer servers that work when im not online

So like pay someone else to host a server?

I'd assume this is possible as it's pretty much a staple in any popular multiplayer game with private servers. But, as with most everything else about KSP2 we don't know for sure yet.

1 hour ago, 5thHorseman said:

So like pay someone else to host a server?

I think he means like Neverwinter Nights servers you could run from your PC.

I did that for a while and it was a blast.

20 minutes ago, Francois424 said:

I think he means like Neverwinter Nights servers you could run from your PC.

I did that for a while and it was a blast.

Oh I thought "while offline" meant he had no access.

I never even considered they wouldn't have a headless server option. And if they don't, you could just leave the full game up.
keep playing ksp1 as well and also lets hope that other people cannot mess with your ships when you are offline
On-board computers which can run auto-pilot programs. Just like kOS. I love coding.

My wish for KSP2:

Everything should be able to function equally well durring real time as durng time warp and offscreen, this includes, special effects, sound effects, engine acceleration, thermal heat simulation. This is an absolute must have for game thatgame that  takes deep space and interstallar exploration seriously as KSP currenly break down when ever you apply any time acceration.

 

Edited October 29, 2019 by FreeThinker

Thought of a thing I would like for colonies. 

The ability to build a runway if an atmosphere is present. If a planet has an atmosphere, you're obviously going to want to fly around in it, and that would require a plane, which requires a runway.... unless they expect us to do VTOLs all the time.

I would really like to see the "auto burn" feature of SimpleRockets 2 added to KSP 2. It might seem obvious, but I was actually surprised by how much convenience this feature provided.

You create a maneuver node, enable auto burn, and then enable time warp. It then warps to shortly before the burn, waits a few seconds, then automatically start and stop the burn at the right time.

I hope modifying planets' orbits and axial tilts are a simple change to a config file. I hope the same for the locations and ecliptic tilts of each star.

I don't need full Kopernicus to be a stock thing but It'd be nice if the basic stuff was easy.

Code all the physics in a way that allow us to create huge and I mean, HUGE orbital / land structures without having to drop our FPS below playable results. 

Is too crap KSP 1 perform soo badly if you have a 100+ parts orbiting any plated with the current GPU Physics/CPU technology.

Thanks

An amendment to my previous want.

I want colony runways, but I want them buildable tiles like everything else in the colony. I want the ability to make a 10 mile runway that tilts up into the sky. I want the ability to build a quarter mile runway that drops off a cliff into a ravine.

I want the abilty to twist and turn those tiles how I see fit, so I can make the Daytona 500 in KSP... or the conceptual circular runway.

4 hours ago, Zarkov2 said:

I would really like to see the "auto burn" feature of SimpleRockets 2 added to KSP 2. It might seem obvious, but I was actually surprised by how much convenience this feature provided.

You create a maneuver node, enable auto burn, and then enable time warp. It then warps to shortly before the burn, waits a few seconds, then automatically start and stop the burn at the right time.

I won't discount the utility of it in the base game - but just want to check to make sure you're aware that MechJeb can do this in KSP1.

Spoiler

18 hours ago, DStaal said:

I won't discount the utility of it in the base game - but just want to check to make sure you're aware that MechJeb can do this in KSP1.

Thanks for the tip. I was aware of autopilot abilities, but not this one specifically (although I guess it's a starting point for a space auto pilot ). I'll definitely use MechJeb in my next career run, and hold off until it's 1.8.x friendly (if that isn't the case now).

I hope that all the planetary systems orbit around a super massive black hole, in which you can fall and get spaghettified !

Edit : i'd love to see Danny 2462 exploiting this feature...

Improved detailed landscapes

servers we can host ourselves

explorable interactive IVA (traverse through the ship,airlocks,etc)

On 10/22/2019 at 2:14 PM, The Doodling Astronaut said:

SPACE TETHERS!!!

Why? We already kerbals already have jetpacks, which are insanely powerful and have a decent amount of fuel.

Something almost no one mentions, I would love to see more water based parts, for example ballast tanks and a better looking seafloor maybe? I would love to explore underwater volcanoes and it would be even more amazing if every planet had different things, for example: Laythe could have underwater corals or something like that, kerbin would also have them but more, eve could have volcanoes and chemicals pouring off the seafloor because its so hot, I would simply love this and would add something more to every planet than just "Landing there"

On 11/2/2019 at 3:21 AM, DunaManiac said:

Why? We already kerbals already have jetpacks, which are insanely powerful and have a decent amount of fuel.

So jeb will not float off into interstellar space "accidentally".

All sorts of new ways to make my ships go boom. I also hope they fixed the issue where if you spin to fast it starts to glitch out.
